page.title: 15Horses in Horsted
page.content:
Our village is a very horsey place because lots of people own and ride horses. My friend Helen owns her own pony and I know six people who ride.
There is a riding stable called Tremains and they have about thirty horses. They have a covered school and an out_door school, with about 6 acres of land. There are plenty of bridle paths around, like the one down Wyatt's Lane and the one to Broadhurst Manor. Horse riders and walkers are allowed to use them. The village is called Horsted Keynes so it is partly named after horses. In the past the name Horsted was spelt Horstede, pronounced Horsteed: it meant a place to keep horses.
